title: Unarmed Strike
excerpt: A melee attack made with a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow. Instead of using a weapon, you use your fist, foot, or another body part.
markdown:
# Unarmed Strike

Instead of using a weapon to make a melee weapon attack, you can use an unarmed strike: a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow.

## Unarmed Strike Rules

### Counts as a Melee Weapon Attack
- An unarmed strike counts as a melee weapon attack for the purposes of game rules
- However, unarmed strikes are **not** weapons, so they don't work with features that require weapons

### Damage
- On a hit, an unarmed strike deals **1 + your Strength modifier** bludgeoning damage
- Most characters deal 1d4 + Strength modifier damage with unarmed strikes

### Proficiency
- You are **always proficient** with unarmed strikes
- You add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll

## Monk Unarmed Strikes

Monks have special rules for unarmed strikes:
- Use Dexterity instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls
- Deal more damage based on Martial Arts die (1d4 at 1st level, scaling up to 1d10 at 17th level)
- Can use unarmed strikes as part of Flurry of Blows
- Can use unarmed strikes as a [[bonus_action]] after taking the [[attack_action|Attack action]]

## Two-Weapon Fighting

You **cannot** use two-weapon fighting with unarmed strikes because:
- Two-weapon fighting requires "light melee weapons in each hand"
- Unarmed strikes are not weapons

## Other Features

### Tavern Brawler Feat
- Increases unarmed strike damage to 1d4 + Strength modifier
- Grants proficiency with improvised weapons
- Allows grappling as a bonus action after hitting with an unarmed strike

### Fighting Style: Unarmed Fighting
- Increases unarmed strike damage to 1d6 (or 1d8 if both hands are free)
- Deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage to grappled creatures at the start of your turn
